Title: Participation on collaborative consumption of online transportation in indonesia
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sanny, L., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Deswantiyar, R., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Collaborative consumption is an economic concept that emphasizes principle of co-produce together. The purpose of this study was to examine the consumer motivation factors that influenced attitude towards collaborative consumption directly and behavior of participation in collaborative consumption indirectly through attitude towards collaborative consumption on application-based online transportation. This research adopted a mixed method with quantitative analysis technique using path analysis through questionnaires to 137 participants and qualitative analysis technique using Miles and Huberman model through interview. The results showed that technological, idealistic, practical, social, and curiosity have positive and significant impact on attitude towards collaborative consumption directly, yet economic and reputation have positive and insignificant impact. However, technological, idealistic, practical, and curiosity have positive and significant impact on behavior of participation in collaborative consumption indirectly, yet social, economic, and reputation have positive and insignificant impact. © International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Collaborative Consumption; Consumer Motivation; Indonesia; Online Transportation
